page.title: 13 TRANSPORT:CANALS
page.content: In a mainly rural area a main feature is the transport links which run in a North-West/South-Easterly direction. These links;road(A51),railway,and the Trent and Mersey Canal run almost parallel to the River Trent. The canal provides local employment, with the situation of Hoo-Mill Boat Yard;here narrow boats are made.The yard sells diesel and gas and provides mooring space.The canal is nowadays used mainly for recreation.A boating holiday is a popular pastime.The Isaac Walton Club fishes one stretch of the canal.The other stretch is owned by British Rail.The canal is also part of local history with its origins dating to the Industrial Revolution. Then it was used to transport coal and pottery.
